ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: This class also featured virtual 1-on-1 voice lessons with the instructors.

Live virtual performance 
Live individual coachings

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to read and understand art songs, gained skill in singing these types of music, and gained more information about the history of French and German music.
I developed a thorough knowledge of composers Schubert and Debussy. I also improved my diction skills in French and German, while honing my vocal technique.
improvement in vocal technique and interpretation of art song; some historical knowledge on the composers we covered
I learned a lot about Schubert and Debussy and learned a lot of new repertoire and improved my ability to sing in a way that is sensitive to style.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was great! I can't think of any possible weaknesses.

Strengths: The course was very informative and perfect for a singer looking to expand their repertoire. The amount of work was very light, which allowed more time to focus on the music, rather than testing.

Weaknesses: None
Fabulous course overall. It caters equally to those of all experience levels -- the individual coachings help with that. I felt guided but not pushed.

Overall I really loved this class, and I think that there was a good mix between singing and lecture. Sometimes the amount of work in terms of meeting with Professor Lalli, having coachings with Sara, going to class, memorizing music/text, doing readings, preparing for a listening quiz, etc. felt like a lot in addition to the other classes I was taking.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The 1-on-1 virtual lessons were an excellent addition to the class and should definitely be kept up.

Singing virtually proved to be very difficult, especially live, but we made it work. Everyone made the effort to prepare prior to each virtual performance, facilitating the process. The teacher called on people randomly, which definitely made virtual class more engaging.

I feel like Professor Lalli did a good job modifying the course for zoom! It was definitely a challenging task, and I felt like I still got a lot out of singing in class and coachings in addition to learning a lot during the lecture portion of the class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! Even if you don't have much background in vocal or musical performance, this class is a great introduction to the works of Schubert and Debussy.
Yes! If you are a classical singer, take this course! You will receive invaluable technical advice and tons of new repertoire!
Absolutely. Take it if you've been singing all your life, take it if you only sing in the shower. Regardless, you will get something out of it.

extras.title:
MUSI 322 01
        Songs of Schubert and Debussy
